reviewText:
Early Access Review

Key given from developer for review purposes.

Well this game sure is something...
Don't get me wrong this game is still in earlt access and I have some hope for it but in this stage it's barely playable...
Pros: ...
-car models
-interesting physics (for having fun, not intended)
-good idea
-nice weapons

Cons:
-repetitive music
-unbeatable AI
-no story
-bad controls (pointless use of mouse)
-zombies can only be run over (tested every weapon)
-crashing in enemies only damages you
-no servers/players
-soooo many bugs
-gameplay gets repetitive pretty fast

Right now it's 2/10 but keep track of this one cuz it has lots of potential and I belive it can be turned in really good expirience.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\n3/20/16: So...this is VERY MUCH early access. No doubt about that. What is here is very rough and I would say at least a year of updates will be needed to make it playable for the majority of Steam users. The menus don't make much sense. The content is at a bare minimum. AI is brutish and easily tricked. That said, it feels like the old Twisted Metal games. There is a lot of potential here. For .99 you get what you pay for at this point, but I have high hopes for this one. Also, Missle Uzi" is the best name for a weapon ever."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have to say, Iron Madness is a pretty interesting game.

However:

Although I do understand this is an Early Access Game, I think it does need plenty of shaping before I starting playing this game purely for the fun of it.

We want to have the community help us shape the game"
- Iron Madness Developers

I want to start by saying that this is a very cool concept and I think this can become something really cool
date:
but I think there are a few corners that need to be smoothed out in the overall shape of this game.

Pros:

Cool Car Models
Multiple gamemodes/maps
Multiple powerups
Multiplayer
Decent Car Physics
Split Screen Mode
Cons:

Music seems repetitive
AI Can become very difficult to beat
Basic car controls
Absolutly NO multiplayer games were available (I looked 4/27/2016)
The environments you play in seem dark and not visually appealing
Many bugs
No storyline
After the first 10 min. of gameplay the game becomes boring.
The price of this game!!!
I bought this game during a 90% discount for $0.49
recommended: but without the discount the game costs $4.99 and for the kind of content and gameplay I currently see
hoursPlayed: $4.99 is extremely overpriced.\n\nAs harsh as it might seem
voteText: I think this game deserves a 1/10 rating - because it is overpriced - but if the price tag would shrink down to ~$1 (until much more content is added) I would give this game a healthy 3/10 because it is obvious to me
helpfulPercent: and probably anybody else that has played the game
votesHelpful:
that this game is not worth $5.

*I crossed out the things which were not an issue anymore.

I will check back later and re-evaluate my review if there are changes because this concept has much
votesTotal: much potential and I would love to see it grow!\n\n3/10
votesFunny: has lots of potential\n\nThanks for reading folks :)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If this gets polished enough it could be the twisted Metal for PC. I do recomend this... In the future.

suggested improvments

Slow down the cars they are too fast to have good battles.

Turns are too fast and sharp when moving.

Missles and bombs are too powerful or the cars are too weak.

Jumps feel too weird being high

more unique looking cars.

I'd suggest using Twisted Metal Black as insparation for the controls/feel of movements.

I want this game to be awesome so devs please take my suggestings to heart. I can easily become a big fan and play it a lot on my youtube channel.

Early Access Review

Great game, if you like twisted metal then this is your game.

Pros:
-6 game modes
-multiplayer
-split screen up to 4 players.
-great physics

Cons:
-Need more work on single player (the devs are working on it) would be interesting to have a story mode.

for me it's 7/10 you can have a lot of fun with it in split screen or with friends in multiplayer, grab it before they change the price.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe game thus far is a good start: Motor City Mayhem. I reckon this has the potential to be every murderous driving game since GW's original and completely mental 1984 release Battlecars" (you may have noticed the alternative name in store). The sountrack is bonkers
recommended: the maps are simple and effective-all in a very Early Access Game. For those of you with a good old-fashioned simple-minded attitude towards direct violence
hoursPlayed: I point out the low cost and potential of this game. For those of you without a sense of humour who just want a cheap game with Steam rewards and suchlike-go away. For anyone witha shred of hope-I suggest that you to look at "Orion: Prelude"
voteText: a giant failure that ended up as a massively popular online game once the moaning clowns were driven from the discussion board by the designers' final release and the fans' support. Get stuck in to this for the price of a third-rate burger and chips or a substandard sandwich that will leave you hungry ten minutes later. It's your choice-a game that may eventually turn into a hilarious killfest for you and your pals when you wish it was 2001 and everything was metal AF
helpfulPercent: or another night in wondering what happened to the last fifteen years. Gentlemen
